comments.body:
Translated:

 

Repairing things

Too many repairs of items.

Every few minutes of digging or flying with elytras, you have to start them. At the beginning the cost is not so big but then ...

Information pops up that repair is too expensive. (Minecraft windows 10 editions)

I gather that this stone would be crafted using items gathered by exploring. But what would it do?

I am all for things that inspire exploration, but there needs to be a payoff.
I agree with Geable Lence, it needs to have a payoff.

Clarified subject to help search results.

Thanks for your contribution.
that was made in the minecraft 1.12 village and pillage update
Why? Shields do the exact same thing, for 100x less the price.

Clarified subject to help search results.

Thanks for your contribution.

well, that would be too OP.
Beside, it would also make shulker box a trash, which mess the game up as the shulker box is a late game item, you must do a hella lots of stuff like entering the nether to finish off the dragon and find the shulker with your own risk!
In my opinion , that type of box should exist but not replacing the shulker one.
Here is my idea, for early game ,the "plain box" should be called the wooden box . That's mean, we will have about 6 type of wooden boxes or 8 if include nether's wood .(and ofcourse portable and nonstackable)
To balance this and also avoiding shulker box rip off, these wooden box will only have 3-6 slots for item, and ofcourse cannot be placed inside shulker box nor the wooden box itself.
And with that in mind, definitely the wooden box is smaller than a chest , remember there are 6 (or 8) type of wooden boxes from different wood type, these boxes are great decorations.
Regarding the recipe , i suggest it should be made with 4logs(single type), 4 leathers and a tripwire hook (or a chest , baley).

Lastly, the main idea behind this is actually quite simple. I want a form of a gift box but not as expensive as shulker box.

Not to shoot your idea down, but sharpening tools is what enchants are for, right? And repairing tools, that‚Äôs why we have anvils and the thing where we put 2 of the same tool in the crafting grid. The grindstone isn‚Äôt too bad of an idea though, neither is the fletching table.

Clarified subject to help search results.

Thanks for your contribution.

I kind of like the idea that these have to be earned, but at the same time I'm not sure they're special enough to deserve it. If these had much better and different systems then it'd make sense to set them apart.
an object that takes you to a different dimension that looks like this
It does work. It just needs to be thunder storming.

Translated:

A block that when active, it was placed in the block inventory

Very overpowered, even with one tree.

I like the idea a bit as its something rare to go exploring for and would require a lot of planning in some cases but a simple tree to duplicate stuff would break the games difficulty and fairness. 

Maybe alternatively a way to farm rare ores would achieve a similar goal without being so instantly glorious with no effort.
If this were to be a thing itd probably have to be powered by something, because this seems sorta over powered for no reason at all
The post describes "What are updrafts?". They are currents of wind that push entities upward. They natural found in the nether but can be made by lighting tall grass on fire.

A developed idea!

I honestly think with potions already in and with the difficulty that comes with something like updrafts I doubt this would work well. I definitely think that there is a potential for player launching of some form in Minecaft, especially with blocks like slime blocks, heavy wind however seems too complex for the game and definitely sounds like something an advanced mod would add. Saying that they did add water currents above certain blocks underwater however i think that was purely to speed up vertical movement underwater.

my suggestion as an alternative feature would be a launcher block, this has the advantage of working with redstone without being so difficult to create and get rid of. Players have really wanted something like this for a long time now, think back to the creations of TNT launchers :)
Soooo is knockback not a thing anymore?, also we don't really need a double jump, just make a potion of leaping

Hello, this appears to be a non-English post. Below you will find a transcription of the topic being discussed.

Title: ‚ÄúLet enchantment be enchanted‚Äù

Text: ‚ÄúIt would be cool if you have something that has been enchanted many times and for which "Too expensive" is displayed from a certain point in time, this does not say but how many experience points it would really cost. And something else. If you enchant books at the enchantment table, you often get books with several enchantments on them. E.g .: combustion II and fire protection IV. But if I want to have burns on my sword, this is not possible because Fire Protection IV blocks this. Tip: I play in the Bedrock Edition Ps4 LG _Pr0sPaNoS_‚Äù

- Translated by Admin.
That would be great üëç!

I think food is supposed to be intentionally difficult to obtain in the Nether. I don't think making it any easier is a good idea. I think the idea behind the Nether Update was to make it possible to live entirely in the Nether, but with a noticeably higher difficultly level compared to the Overworld.

i think that is not going to happen. mainly as it would make food a lot easier to get in the nether, too easy really. but i think some of the nether plants could be used in suspicious stews. which would add more use to them.
This would be soooo helpful for colour-coding more redstone.
Deepslate got it, why not stone variants? :)

A use for Rubies (1/2)

Rubies were meant to be in place of emeralds, and emeralds are green, green is the opposite of red, so rubies should have an opposite function to emeralds (as in revenge). I don't think there should be anything like "untrading" with villagers, I think villagers would hate rubies, they would walk away from the ruby ‚Äã‚Äãblock, so we would have the mechanics of directing villagers where we want without having to move them with boats or mine minecarts . But there is a mob that is the opposite of the villagers, the illagers! So should we be traiding with them? I don't think so, we already have a traiding with a hostile mob, the piglins. But I think there should be a similar mechanic with distracting piglins with gold. I don't think you need a set of tools and armor of rubies, but only the block, also because we only have the block of the emerald. So I think that unlike the villagers, the illagers would love the rubies and be distracted by the block of rubies, they would gather around the block and be distracted by it for about a minute (or less) then they would break it! So the illagers could also "steal" the rubies from the player! So they have one more reason to hate villagers. Rubies, unlike the emeralds that are generated in the mountains, would be generated under the deep seas. So there could be an explanation of the shipwrecks, maybe some time ago some illagers were looking for rubies under the sea but then they sank for some reason (maybe mob A).
I want this in minecraft so baddddddd
It looks awesome
Maple syrup
By the way this should help a lot of people that don't want to go to the end or have never went there for some reason like me.
i think you guys need to put this voting in a video or something because i didn't even know this until i search up can you upgrade bundles
you should make it so you can upgrade it but it will be hard to find the book to upgrade it

Okay idea, only problem for me is that iron, copper, diamond, etc. Doesn't really work as a bag (especially diamond). But you could maybe use leather instead of rabbit hides for more durability, and maybe more space.

yes but i dont like the crafting

i feel like it should be crafted like this:

 air   |     air     |   air
--------------------------------
bundle | rabbit hide | feather     = bundle #1
--------------------------------
air    |     air     |   air

 

and u can do this until u max out at bundle #32

and each upgrade = 1 more rabbit hide and feather

each upgrade makes it 1 stack bigger

This would be awesome! Maybe they could add a new jack o' lantern type by using a soul torch.

Another idea that just popped in my head was lighting (with a torch/ soul torch) and unlighting (water?) the jack o' lantern could be a way to change it's face/ look. Each time you light it, it changes. (And possibly a way to lock the face so no one griefs your builds)

There was a second idea to graze my head while I wrote the last comment: 

In the Warden introduction there were candles, perhaps these candles could come in many colors and they would replace the use a torch for crafting a jack o' lantern. Now I know, colored candle, colored lighting, I mean maybe? But at the very least it would change the color of the face and its look (red - anger, blue - sad, light grey... chilling fear?). 

[Side-idea you could go crazy and change the jack o' lanterns color to and get... many combinations... (I included a plain candle in my calculation; only 272) just saying :]

Thought I'd make this a separate comment just in case people liked this more.
It would probably work best if it was random. Like you get a chance of getting one of the 5 face options for jack-o-lanterns! It would be a cool halloween update, but that is pretty soon

I think that they should work in a diferent way. By updragind a arrow with copper it should do the same damege (and still be allowe to be tipped with potions) But have a longer range (as a metal tiped arrow is way more stable than a flint one irl)

I like the idea of Copper Arrows. I was just about to write my own Post about them but decided to just comment on yours. 

The crafting is exactly what I envisioned: adding a copper ingot to 8 or 16 or so arrows to make them copper-tipped.

The buff I had in mind was slightly different. Though still taking longer to charge, I figured they would fly farther and straighter, deal more damage, and also work well underwater.

Having copper arrows would work wonderfully in conjunction to ANOTHER idea I saw recommending the addition of Crowssbow with Telescope, which is basically a Scoped variant of the crossbow. Both of these ideas would add more use to copper, and underused items. And, working together, they could create a very useful and unique ranged weapon.

As for the lightning, I would be afraid to mimic something like a Channeling Trident too closely. Maybe instead, they add some sort of electricity bank, that when struck by lightning on an adjacent Lightning Rod, becomes charged.

You could then right-click this charged electricity bank thing with Copper Arrows in hand to charge the arrows, but deplete the electric bank. But then you have a limited number of Charged Copper Arrows. This would give a balanced buff to Lightning Rods, and copper in general. It would also encourage players to treat Thunderstorms as some kind of limited resource, during which they can be ready to charge as many Copper Arrows they can before the storm is over.

I loved your idea!
Its a perfect idea so we can make them as treasures in maps so you mine and find a pot and get the items from it or in survival you can use them as storage chests but designed so you put them on table in your base i realy loved your idea
They should spawn in structures instead of chests, like they do in Minecraft Dungeons

Pots should hold one item stack but have no inventory UI. You put items in by right clicking them on the pot or using hoppers or dispensors. You can remove items using hoppers or breaking the pot.

The benefits are:
-unique function for redstone devices like item filters
-map makers can hide loot in smashables like an adventure game
-thematic function for decorative item in builds

i got a better idea: the pots should hold potions, it would be cool if they could store the volume of like 10 or more potions of a type. Then if you want to take some out you just rightclick with an empty bottle and get the potion, also they could add some small pixelart onto the pots to make each type of potion identifiable.

-Additionally barrels could get an added similar function so that people can choose wether they want to store liquid or items.

+ let hoppers interact with potions to make automatic brewing more compact and enjoyable
I think It should make a lava seeing/swimming potion too.
Maybe they could have more of a grey tone.. Logs and planks!

Perhaps just log blocks for the main log, with dark oak in the middle, but they could be HUGE, the height of a small 4x4 jungle tree, but with more bigger branches. The lowest branches would be dark oak. They would have a super low chance to spawn in forests, dark oak forests, and jungles. They would also have a chance to spawn having been split by lightning.

They could add a new leaf, though not a new log. Elder oak leaves have a chance of dropping acorns, apples, golden apples, enchanted golden apples, and sweet berries. They would also have a chance to spawn with beehives on them.

They would spawn with vines.

Perhapse there could be a way to get syrup from such trees? (I can't help but want maple syrup in Minecraft, it is essential)
I think you could use redstone to replace the furnace in the crafting recipe
I love your idea
My brother got this idea and I came up with the same details you did HippedHiDude. I got it from minecon 2018
